intro: Cnidoscolus matosii, commonly known as the Mexican stinging leaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Central America and parts of South America, particularly in tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and striking yellow flowers. Its leaves contain a milky sap that can cause skin irritation, similar to other members of the genus. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
